title: A glimpse of joy for the happy restoring of the Kings most Excellent Majesty or, The devoir's of a nameless poet. To the generall's excellence, and to all the noble sparks of Great Brittain's heroarchy, that have hopes to survive their countrey's sufferings.
publisher: Printed for John Andrews, at the White Lion near Pye-Corner,
notes: Verse - "What Glimpse is that I see? A Rising SUN,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
